value.title: What is a datamart? | Compared with data lakes, data warehouses & databases
value.excerpt: Have you heard about Data Marts but you don't understand what they are?  Here is a simplified view that explains it and compares it with other existing data technologies.  Note that this is a simplified view and your data architecture does not/ might not follow the model shown here.  Here you can download

value.title: 3 ways to REDUCE DATA In Power BI Desktop (No Premium needed!)
value.excerpt: Sometimes you want to reduce data in Power BI Desktop so it's easier to work with. Then work with all the data in the Power BI Service. Patrick shows you 3 ways that can help do this without using Incremental Refresh or needing Power BI Premium!  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Bringing Paginated into Power BI reports - INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: It's here! Have a look at the Power BI Paginated visual for your Power BI Reports! It adds additional flexibility for displaying data as well as providing easy export options if that's your jam.  Blog Announcement: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/paginated-report-visual-for-power-bi-reports-is-now-available-in-public-preview/

value.title: Call any Power BI REST API with PowerShell

value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
value.excerpt: Not a coder? Don't understand DAX syntax? DAX can be intimidating and difficult to learn. Frustrating even! Learning DAX can make Power BI very rewarding. Adam has some resources to get you started in your journey.  Beginning the journey:  MS Learn: User DAX in Power BI Desktop (Free) https://docs.microsoft.com/learn/paths/dax-power-bi/

value.title: Debugging a slow Power BI report with Phil Seamark

This uses some new features in Power BI Desktop as well as using DAX Studio to get further insights. value.title: Dynamic filtering with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at taking URL filtering to the next level. He shows how to use dynamic filtering with Power BI reports. He also shows a neat trick of setting a link image for Web URL fields.  Filtering in Power BI: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/filter-a-report-with-a-url-query-string-parameter/

value.title: Get the most as a Data Scientist with Microsoft Fabric (Public Preview)

value.title: Power BI dataflows vs datamarts: What's the difference???
